description: Data was loaded from the extensive characterization of probes on the Infinium MethylationEPIC microarray, in September 2018. The data is based on the file http://zwdzwd.io/InfiniumAnnotation/20180909/EPIC/EPIC.hg19.manifest.tsv.gz Note that column "gene_HGNC", which in the original table contains a semi-colon delimited string, has been denormalized in this table, so that each row includes a reference to only one gene, and methylation probes that are in/near multiple genes will have some information repeated on multiple rows. More details: see Zhou W, Laird PW and Shen H, Comprehensive characterization, annotation and innovative use of Infinium DNA Methylation BeadChip probes, Nucleic Acids Research 2017 https://academic.oup.com/nar/article/45/4/e22/2290930. This table is hosted with the permission of the authors.

fields.description: CpG genomic coordinate: chromosome, e.g., chr1, chrX, etc (can be blank)
fields.name: CpG_chrm

fields.description: CpG genomic coordinate: start position (can be blank)
fields.name: CpG_beg

fields.description: CpG genomic coordinate: end position (can be blank)
fields.name: CpG_end

fields.description: CpG genomic coordinate: probe strand, e.g.,+ or - (can be blank)
fields.name: probe_strand

fields.description: CpG probe identifier, e.g.,cg04382991
fields.name: probeID

fields.description: Address of probe A on the chip designated by the original manifest
fields.name: address_A

fields.description: Address of probe B on the chip designated by the original manifest (blank for type II probes)
fields.name: address_B

fields.description: Red orGrnfor type I probes, andBoth for type II probes
fields.name: channel

fields.description: I or II
fields.name: designType

fields.description: The actual extension base (on the probe strand) after bisulfite conversion: one ofG/A ,A ,C , orT(can be blank, but very rarely)
fields.name: nextBase

fields.description: The extension base (on the hybridized DNA) before bisulfite conversion: one of C, G, A, or T (can be blank, but very rarely)
fields.name: nextBaseRef

fields.description: Either:cg(most common),ch, orrs
fields.name: probeType

fields.description: Up(as in upstream, always on + strand) ordown (as in downstream, always on - strand)
fields.name: orientation

fields.description: Number of CpGs in probe: range is [0,9], most frequent counts are 1, 0, 2, 3 (in that order)
fields.name: probeCpGcnt

fields.description: Number of CpGs in the [-35bp,+35bp] window: range is [0,19], most frequent counts are 1-10 (in numeric order)
fields.name: context35

fields.description: Mapped start position of the probe (probes are always 50bp long)
fields.name: probeBeg

fields.description: Mapped end position of the probe (probes are always 50bp long), so end = start + 50 - 1
fields.name: probeEnd

fields.description: Sequence for probe A, e.g.,TTAATAAAAACCTTATAAAATCTTACCCTAACTCTCCAACAATACTTTAC
fields.name: ProbeSeq_A

fields.description: Sequence for probe B, e.g.,ACTCTAATTTCGCGCAAACGATCCAATAATCCCGAAAATCGAATAAAACG
fields.name: ProbeSeq_B

fields.description: A single HGNC gene symbol (when probes are in/near multiple genes, this information has been spread out over multiple rows in this table; genes were checked using HGNChelper for compatibility with HGNC; gene models follow GENCODE version 22 (hg38). Unique HGNC human loci identifier. The HGNC is responsible for approving unique symbols and names for human loci, including protein coding genes, ncRNA genes and pseudogenes. (See https://www.genenames.org/about/ and https://www.ebi.ac.uk/miriam/main/collections/MIR:00000362)
fields.name: gene_HGNC

fields.description: Chromosome for probe A, excluding decoy chromosomes
fields.name: chrm_A

fields.description: Start position for probe A
fields.name: beg_A

fields.description: Bitwise flags: usually 0 or 16 (10000:reverse complemented sequence), rarely 4 (00100:segment unmapped)
fields.name: flag_A

fields.description: Phred mapping quality score (in [0,60], with 60 being the best - and most frequent value). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phred_quality_score
fields.name: mapQ_A

fields.description: CIGAR string: describing how probe sequence aligns with reference. E.g.,40M1D10M. The probe sequence being aligned to a reference may have additional bases that are not in the reference or may be missing bases that are in the reference. The CIGAR string is a sequence of of base lengths and the associated operation. it is used to indicate which bases align (either a match/mismatch) with the reference, are deleted from the reference, and or are insertions that are not in the reference.
fields.name: cigar_A

fields.description: Edit distance: usually 0, occasionally > 0 (largest value is 8)
fields.name: NM_A

fields.description: Chromosome for probe B, excluding decoy chromosomes
fields.name: chrm_B

fields.description: Start position for probe B
fields.name: beg_B

fields.description: Bitwise flags: blank for type II probes, otherwise usually 0 or 16 (10000:reverse complemented sequence), rarely 4 (00100:segment unmapped)
fields.name: flag_B

fields.description: Phred mapping quality score (in [0,60], with 60 being the best - and most frequent value (except when blank, for type II probes))Seehttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phred_quality_score
fields.name: mapQ_B

fields.description: CIGAR string: describing how probe sequence aligns with the reference, E.g., 50M (or blank, for type II probes).The probe sequence being aligned to a reference may have additional bases that are not in the reference or may be missing bases that are in the reference. The CIGAR string is a sequence of of base lengths and the associated operation. it is used to indicate which bases align (either a match/mismatch) with the reference, are deleted from the reference, and or are insertions that are not in the reference.
fields.name: cigar_B

fields.description: Edit distance: usually 0, occasionally > 0 (or blank, for type II probes)
fields.name: NM_B

fields.description: Chromosome for probe A, INCLUDING decoy chromosomes
fields.name: wDecoy_chrm_A

fields.description: Start position for probe A
fields.name: wDecoy_beg_A

fields.description: Bitwise flags, e.g., 0 or 16
fields.name: wDecoy_flag_A

fields.description: Phred mapping quality score (in [0,60], with 60 being the best)Seehttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phred_quality_score
fields.name: wDecoy_mapQ_A

fields.description: CIGAR string: describing how probe sequence aligns with reference. E.g.,40M1D10M. The probe sequence being aligned to a reference may have additional bases that are not in the reference or may be missing bases that are in the reference. The CIGAR string is a sequence of of base lengths and the associated operation. it is used to indicate which bases align (either a match/mismatch) with the reference, are deleted from the reference, and or are insertions that are not in the reference.
fields.name: wDecoy_cigar_A

fields.description: Edit distance: either 0 or 1
fields.name: wDecoy_NM_A

fields.description: Chromosome for probe B, INCLUDING decoy chromosomes
fields.name: wDecoy_chrm_B

fields.description: Start position for probe B
fields.name: wDecoy_beg_B

fields.description: Bitwise flags, e.g., 0 or 16
fields.name: wDecoy_flag_B

fields.description: Phred mapping quality score (in [0,60], with 60 being the best)Seehttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phred_quality_score
fields.name: wDecoy_mapQ_B

fields.description: CIGAR string: describing how probe sequence aligns with reference. E.g.,40M1D10M. The probe sequence being aligned to a reference may have additional bases that are not in the reference or may be missing bases that are in the reference. The CIGAR string is a sequence of of base lengths and the associated operation. it is used to indicate which bases align (either a match/mismatch) with the reference, are deleted from the reference, and or are insertions that are not in the reference.
fields.name: wDecoy_cigar_B

fields.description: Edit distance: either 0 or 1
fields.name: wDecoy_NM_B

fields.description: True or false. For hg19 only: whether the mapping matches the original manifest
fields.name: posMatch

fields.description: True or false. Whether the probe is masked for mapping reason; probes retained should have high quality (>=40 on 0-60 scale) consistent (with designed MAPINFO) mapping (for both in the case of type I) without INDELs
fields.name: MASK_mapping

fields.description: True or false. Whether the 15bp 3prime-subsequence of the probe overlaps with repeat masker; this MASK is NOT recommended
fields.name: MASK_typeINextBaseSwitch

fields.description: True or false. Whether the 15bp 3prime-subsequence of the probe overlaps with repeat masker; this MASK is NOT recommended
fields.name: MASK_rmsk15

fields.description: True or false. Whether the 40bp 3prime-subsequence of the probe is non-unique
fields.name: MASK_sub40_copy

fields.description: True or false. Whether the 35bp 3prime-subsequence of the probe is non-unique
fields.name: MASK_sub35_copy

fields.description: True or false. Whether the 30bp 3prime-subsequence of the probe is non-unique
fields.name: MASK_sub30_copy

fields.description: True or false. Whether the 25bp 3prime-subsequence of the probe is non-unique
fields.name: MASK_sub25_copy

fields.description: True or false. Whether 5bp 3prime-subsequence (including extension for typeII) overlaps with any of the common SNPs from dbSNP (global MAF can be under 1%)
fields.name: MASK_snp5_common

fields.description: True or false. Whether 5bp 3prime -subsequence (including extension for typeII) overlaps with any of the SNPs with global MAF >1%
fields.name: MASK_snp5_GMAF1p

fields.description: True or false. Probes masked for extension base inconsistent with specified color channel (type-I) or CpG (type-II) based on mapping
fields.name: MASK_extBase

fields.description: True or false. Recommended general purpose masking merged from MASK_sub30_copy, MASK_mapping, MASK_extBase, MASK_typeINextBaseSwitch and MASK_snp5_GMAF1p
fields.name: MASK_general
